meanings.definition: The act or process of inoculating.
meanings.sent1: The inoculation was quick and painless.
meanings.sent2: The doctor performed the inoculation to protect the child from getting sick.
meanings.sent3: The inoculation seemed like a magic spell to keep away the germs.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an inoculation against the gloomy mood in the room.
meanings.sent5: The inoculation felt like a shield guarding against illness.

meanings.definition: The introduction of a serum, vaccine, or antigenic substance into the body to produce immunity to a specific disease.
meanings.sent1: After the inoculation, the body developed defenses against the virus.
meanings.sent2: The inoculation helped prevent the spread of the flu.
meanings.sent3: The inoculation turned the body into a superhero fighting off the illness.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was an inoculation against failure.
meanings.sent5: The inoculation was like a superhero cape protecting from disease.

meanings.definition: The introduction of microorganisms or viruses into a culture medium.
meanings.sent1: The scientist carefully monitored the inoculation of the bacteria.
meanings.sent2: The inoculation of the virus into the cell culture was successful.
meanings.sent3: The inoculation of the microbes felt like a tiny invasion.
meanings.sent4: The new idea was an inoculation that spread rapidly through the team.
meanings.sent5: The inoculation of knowledge transformed the research project.
